dcterms:title: A small protein coded within the mitochondrial canonical gene nd4 regulates mitochondrial bioenergetics
dcterms:abstract: Mitochondria play a crucial role in cellular functions and are implicated in several diseases. Our study identifies a newly characterized alternative open reading frame (altORF) within the mitochondrial gene nd4, encoding a conserved polypeptide, MTALTND4, which is involved in mitochondrial physiology.

fabio:hasPart.dcterms:title: Introduction
fabio:hasPart.fabio:hasContent: Mitochondria are often referred to as the powerhouses of the cell, and their contribution to various cellular processes is paramount.

fabio:hasPart.dcterms:title: Results
fabio:hasPart.fabio:hasContent: We identified a downstream alternative ATG initiation codon in the +3 reading frame of the human mitochondrial nd4 gene, leading to the encoding of 99-amino-acid-long polypeptide MTALTND4.

cito:cites.dcterms:title: A critical review on mitochondrial function
Mitochondrial dynamics: from housekeepers to key players
